about_the_game:
Life sometimes tests even the most innocent hearts with deep trauma. "Ted's Journey" is an emotional and thought-provoking simulation game in which you take on the responsibility of adopting little Ted, who has tragically lost his mother.

Game Features:

Emotional Depth: Touch Ted's life and contribute to his healing process. Every decision you make affects Ted's spiritual and emotional growth.

Personal Relationships: Provide Ted with love and support so that he can grow up in a safe environment. Build a strong bond by making decisions that meet his needs.

Development and Traumas: Try to understand Ted's traumas and offer appropriate approaches. In this journey, you will encounter various challenges and emotional barriers.

Mechanics of Decision Making: Your choices have a direct impact on Ted's personal development. Each choice shapes Ted's state of mind and overall well-being. Remember that Ted's behavior is shaped by his emotional state. Raising an overconfident child can undermine your authority. Try to keep his emotions within a healthy range.

Educational and Informative: Filled with content that will help you learn about child development and psychological healing, this game offers both a fun and educational experience.

We are waiting for you to bring out the best version of Ted on this meaningful journey through his life. Free Ted from his traumas, give him a secure future and enjoy this healing journey with him!

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 18.04
  • Processor: 64-bit
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 4.5

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: macOS 10.12
  • Processor: 64-bit
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM GB RAM
  • Graphics: DX10, DX11, DX12

name: Ted

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows 7 64bit
  • Processor: 64-bit
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM GB RAM
  • Graphics: DX10,DX11,DX12
  • Sound Card: DX10,DX11,DX12

short_description: Parent Ted, your own childhood. On this journey, you will have the chance to discover your inner child and better understand the trauma and emotions of your childhood.
